chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
v: nat -> R
u: nat -> R
l2: Rbar
l1: Rbar

Goal:
(forall n : nat, u n <= v n) -> is_lim_seq u l1 -> is_lim_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Rbar_le = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 <= y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => match y with | p_infty => True | _ => False end | m_infty => True end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
is_lim_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => filterlim u eventually (Rbar_locally l) : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lim_seq_le_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l1 l2 : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> is_lim_seq u l1 -> is_lim_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_sup_seq_le : forall (u v : nat -> Rbar) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> is_sup_seq u l1 -> is_sup_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_inf_seq_le : forall (u v : nat -> Rbar) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> is_inf_seq u l1 -> is_inf_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_lim_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
is_lim_seq_ext_loc : forall (u v : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), eventually (fun n : nat => u n = v n) -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq v l
LimSup_le : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (LimSup_seq u) (LimSup_seq v)
Lim_seq_le_loc : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (Lim_seq u) (Lim_seq v)
LimInf_le : forall u v : nat -> R, eventually (fun n : nat => u n <= v n) -> Rbar_le (LimInf_seq u) (LimInf_seq v)
Sup_seq_le : forall u v : nat -> Rbar, (forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> Rbar_le (Sup_seq u) (Sup_seq v)
Inf_seq_le : forall u v : nat -> Rbar, (forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> Rbar_le (Inf_seq u) (Inf_seq v)
filter_imp : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x -> Q x) -> ?F P -> ?F Q where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_locally : forall (f : ?T -> ?U) (y : ?U), filterlim f ?F (locally y) < -> (forall eps : posreal, ?F (fun x : ?T => ball y eps (f x))) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- UniformSpace] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_const : forall a : ?U, filterlim (fun _ : ?T => a) ?F (locally a) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- UniformSpace] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filterlim_ext_loc : forall f g : ?T -> ?U, ?F (fun x : ?T => f x = g x) -> filterlim f ?F ?G -> filterlim g ?F ?G where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type] ?U : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?G : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- (?U -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
filter_and : forall P Q : ?T -> Prop, ?F P -> ?F Q -> ?F (fun x : ?T => P x /\ Q x) where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type] ?F : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Filter ?F]
Rbar_is_glb_subset : forall (E1 E2 : Rbar -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : Rbar, E2 x -> E1 x) -> Rbar_is_glb E1 l1 -> Rbar_is_glb E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
Rbar_is_lub_subset : forall (E1 E2 : Rbar -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : Rbar, E1 x -> E2 x) -> Rbar_is_lub E1 l1 -> Rbar_is_lub E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
Proper_StrongProper : forall F : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop, ProperFilter F -> ProperFilter' F where ?T : [u : nat -> R v : nat -> R l1 : Rbar l2 : Rbar |- Type]
is_lim_seq_subseq : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) (phi : nat -> nat), filterlim phi eventually eventually -> is_lim_seq u l -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (phi n)) l
is_glb_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_glb_Rbar E1 l1 -> is_glb_Rbar E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_lub_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_lub_Rbar E1 l1 -> is_lub_Rbar E2 l2 -> Rbar_le l2 l1
Rbar_lb_le_ub : forall (E : Rbar -> Prop) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (exists x : Rbar, E x) -> Rbar_is_lower_bound E l1 -> Rbar_is_upper_bound E l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_LimInf_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < l0 + eps) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> l0 - eps < u n) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> M < u n | m_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_LimSup_seq = fun (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall N : nat, exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ l0 - eps < u n) /\ (exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < l0 + eps) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (N : nat), exists n : nat, (N <= n)%nat /\ M < u n | m_infty => forall M : R, exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> u n < M end : (nat -> R) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_lim_seq_incr_1 : forall (u : nat -> R) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (S n)) l
is_inf_seq_glb : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_inf_seq u l -> Rbar_is_glb (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l
is_sup_seq_lub : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_sup_seq u l -> Rbar_is_lub (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l
is_lim_seq_incr_n : forall (u : nat -> R) (N : nat) (l : Rbar), is_lim_seq u l < -> is_lim_seq (fun n : nat => u (n + N)%nat) l
Lim_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> R, ex_lim_seq u -> is_lim_seq u (Lim_seq u)
Lim_seq_correct' : forall u : nat -> R, ex_finite_lim_seq u -> is_lim_seq u (Lim_seq u)

```coq
intros Huv Hul1 Hvl2.
apply is_lim_seq_le_loc with (u := u) (v := v) (l1 := l1) (l2 := l2).
- unfold eventually. exists 0. intros n Hn.
  apply Huv.
- exact Hul1.
- exact Hvl2.
Qed.
```
